title: James Brennan (footballer)
text:
James Francis Brennan (10 September 1884 – 6 September 1917) was an Irish professional <a href="Association%20football">football</a> <a href="inside%20right">inside right</a> who made one appearance in the <a href="Football%20League">Football League</a> for <a href="Bury%20F.C.">Bury</a>. He also played in the <a href="Southern%20Football%20League">Southern League</a> for <a href="Brighton%20%26amp%3B%20Hove%20Albion%20F.C.">Brighton & Hove Albion</a>.
Personal life.
Brennan attended <a href="Prior%20Park%20College">Prior Park College</a> in <a href="Bath%2C%20Somerset">Bath</a>. He served in the <a href="King%27s%20Regiment%20%28Liverpool%29">King's Regiment (Liverpool)</a> and the <a href="Lancashire%20Fusiliers">Lancashire Fusiliers</a> during the <a href="First%20World%20War">First World War</a> and was holding the rank of <a href="corporal">corporal</a> when he was <a href="killed%20in%20action">killed in action</a> in <a href="West%20Flanders">West Flanders</a>, <a href="Belgium">Belgium</a> on 6 September 1917. Brennan is commemorated on the <a href="Tyne%20Cot%20Memorial%20to%20the%20Missing">Tyne Cot Memorial to the Missing</a>.
Honours.
Africa Royal
